questions.question: Why did John Proctor rip his confession to shreds?

choices.answer: He didn't want his name to be ruined.
He did not want his wife to think that he was a bad person.
He was angry at Deputy Governor Danforth.

questions.question: What did Tituba say about the way the Devil lived in Barbados?

choices.answer: The Devil is evil and he kills people for sport.
The Devil has no honor and is hiding in Barbados.
The Devil is singing and dancing in Barbados.
The Devil does not exist in Barbados.

questions.question: Who vanished with Reverend Parris's 31 pounds?
Who believed in witches until Act 4?
Why did Reverend Hale ask Elizabeth Proctor to convince John to confess?

choices.answer: Reverend Hale has a deep affection for John Proctor.
Reverend Hale feels remorse for what he has done to Salem.
John Proctor owes Reverend Hale money.

questions.question: What did Giles Corey say when he was about to die?
In act four, Arthur Miller uses the word, "pretense." What does that word mean?

choices.answer: You are looking at the future.
You are lying or trying to cover up the truth.
It is not a real word.

questions.question: Who did Elizabeth say the highest judge for John Proctor is?
Whom does John Proctor say he saw with the Devil?
What was the reason for John Proctor to sign the confession that proved he committed a crime?

choices.answer: The village needed to understand that Proctor was a bad man.
Mr. Danforth wants to destroy Proctor's reputation.
They wanted an excuse to use up paper.
The court needed legal proof of Proctor's crimes.

questions.question: Why didn't Elizabeth go to her husband as he is going to die?

choices.answer: Proctor became good and Elizabeth wouldn't ruin that fact.
Elizabeth actually does try to convince Proctor to confess.
Proctor is with the Devil and Elizabeth won't speak to him.

questions.question: What was one of the effects of the Salem Witch Trials?

choices.answer: Lots of orphans were wandering around.
Cows were wandering on the roads.
Mr. Parris was dancing and singing in the street.
All of Salem was begging for Rebecca Nurse to be hanged.

questions.question: Why did Reverend Hale return to Salem?

choices.answer: He was not needed in Andover.
He wasn't doing anything else that day.
He came to pray with the accused.
